title: Hey Riot you wanna know why adc's are building steraks
body:
Its not because it's Op. Its because it's pretty much the only current counter to your precious assassins. You know...the class you inexplicably decided to buff with an item tailor made for them. An archtype that's so obnoxious to face as they really only can be counter builded rather than counter played against, due to ridiculous amounts of lcs big play kits that let them outplay anyone. 

So before you nerf sterak's because people are constantly building it, look at the symptoms first. It's build purely because  it helps carries to survive the instant burst of assassins. So hopefully they can actually survive long enough to actually play the game of league of legends.

replies.body: assassins are better than tanks im welcoming the assassin meta back with open arms

Much less play.

Not to mention tank meta allowed everyone to play. yes, even assassins, the difference that they couldnt simply rush to the adc and get a triple, they had to actually play like assassins, but none was ''useless''.

Assassin meta is back to 3s teamfights and assassins crowding out anyone that isnt an assassin or an assassin counter (counters that Rito loves to nerf or remo- _rework_ {{champion:90}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:26}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:43}} ).

If juggernauts were done properly they would counter assassins as well.

Juggernauts were designed primarily for doing damage rather than peeling though, so not really intended to counter assassins. They can stand in front of their squishy allies and try to zone off assassins with the threat of massive damage, but that's it really.
Which would be an issue if every assassin didn't have such a hugely telegraphed part of their combo with "COUNTERPLAY" written all over it.

> {{champion:91}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:121}} buy pinks and ward your flanks, low elo scrub.

Warding applies to all champions. Not just assassins.
My point was they their assassination patterns come out *super* fast. You can position all day long, but you don't know they're going in until they actually 100-0 you (or die trying). The exception being Rengar who sprints on top of you at high speed from stealth.(Kha'Zix was a joke. I was going for the cheap laugh. I'm not sorry.)

This is counter from other assassination who have clear telegraphs pre-empting your untimely death.
{{champion:238}} Ult.
{{champion:245}} stun.
{{champion:28}} Actually has a very slow assassination.
{{champion:76}} Lands ~~ICBM~~ spear.
{{champion:35}} AD: slow assassination pattern. AP: you're chasing him or he is chasing you.

Let me put it this way, if a champion had a *super* fast assassination every time the clock hit X:00 or X:30, would his pattern be telegraphed?

The thing is, those assassins can't do *anything* if you ward against them. Thats definitely not true for everyone.

If they always all-in at X:00 or X:30, then yes; the pattern is telegraphed.

I don't know of any assassin (or champion for that matter) that follows the clock that closely.

You can pink Rengar (though he'll just barrel past it Rammus style), Shaco, Eve, Talon (who will also barrel past it). Wards won't do squat for stopping Leblanc, Akali, Annie, Nidalee, Zed, or Ekko.

(Note that [generically] getting flanked/ganked is not inherently an assassination pattern as it pertains to this discussion.)
I heard pink wards are good for dealing with Kennen's ultimate.
Jus pink ward Zed's Ult, scrub.
Pinks wards op. must nerf rito!
Better nerf Irelia. She has too much synergy with pink wards.

Ok, so why aren't ADC building GA instead? That WAS why GA was standard on ADC in season 2, 3 and even early 4.

It's because Sterak's is just as good as GA's defenses if not BETTER, AND it also has a lot of offensive potential AND it has a better recipe. Quite frankly, Sterak's has strange design to begin with. The only people who benefit from it are the people who take lots of damage. Resistances make it harder to proc it and also longer. So it's only on bruisers who stack health. But they don't get bursted. They get kited or cced and ignored. No, the carries are the ones that get jumped AND are squishy. They are the perfect users of Sterak's, not bruisers.

If it's supposed to be a bruiser item, then the requires for the shield need to change so that it rewards tankiness, not getting burst down.

I'd say this is more of an issue with how bad GA has been over the years, but since it had no competition everyone was forced to use it. Now that another item has come along that offers similar benefits in a better way, no one is even looking twice in GA's direction. And they shouldn't, it's a horribly put together item; build path and stat wise.

If anything, it's GA that should be changed, not Gage.

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VAvN8Jmn,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-12T21:51:48.202+0000)
>
> Ok, so why aren't ADC building GA instead? That WAS why GA was standard on ADC in season 2, 3 and even early 4.

The cooldown on the Sterak's Fury passive is 45 seconds. The cooldown on Guardian Angel's revive passive is 5 minutes...

Be honest, this problem of ADC's needing tankiness for assassins only arose with the new multi-ADC meta. Of course champions like Zed/Master Yi/Fiora are going to slaughter their way through a team with 3 ADC's (a comp I see too often these days), that's just the price you pay for not forming a balanced team.

The problem is artificial. ADC's are in need of defense not because assassins are eviscerating them with ease, but because they are now taking the lanes of the champions that traditionally offered them protection. I never see the classic single-ADC comp buying Steraks because they simply don't need it, they get more than enough defense from the 4 other champions on their team. It's only the solo lane ADC's like Graves/Quinn/Kindred who buy it because they have no one to protect them. They are just abusing Steraks in an attempt to overcome the intended weakness of their class. An isolated ADC **SHOULD NOT** stand a chance in hell against assassins, that's just the cold truth about how League works and was hardly a problem until people decided that 3 ADC's can each somehow carry all at the same time, and that solo lane ADC's are a safe and reliable pick.

Assassins are supposed to burst you down. Limited counterplay is intended.

But there is counterplay, and it's called teamwork. When against an Assassin, just don't leave your allies. Most Assassins wouldn't be able to make it out alive, even if they do kill you, if you stay by allies.
